meanings.definition: Not able to be tilled or cultivated.
meanings.sent1: The rocky terrain was untillable, making it impossible to grow crops.
meanings.sent2: Farmers avoided the untillable land as it was too hard to work on.
meanings.sent3: The untillable soil seemed to mock the farmer's efforts to plant anything.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt untillable, barren of any love or joy.
meanings.sent5: The untillable field lay desolate under the scorching sun.

meanings.definition: Incapable of being prepared for planting.
meanings.sent1: The swampy area was untillable, too wet for any seeds to take root.
meanings.sent2: The untillable ground remained untouched, a challenge for any gardener.
meanings.sent3: The untillable garden plot seemed to play a trick on the eager farmer.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt untillable, unable to nurture any new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The untillable soil rejected every attempt to grow something new.
